alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 8:47PM MST until January 18 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow likely. Snow accumulations greater than 5 inches are currently forecast. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to treacherous. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is still uncertainty in the track of this system which could impact where heaviest snowfalls occur. Easterly winds becoming northerly could gust up to 35 mph could lead to blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. If you are planning to travel, be prepared to adjust your plans.
